00040 #ifndef _crossplatform_h
00041 #define _crossplatform_h
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 /// @namespace phys::crossplatform
00044 /// @brief All functionality that needs different implemenations per platform will go in here
00045 /// @details If we did our jobs right You not need to change anything to compile on
00046 /// different platforms exvept the build target. If you want, the platform can
00047 /// be manually defined in this section and this should be the only place that you
00048 /// need to change to compile this on a supported platform. Just remark all the
00049 /// lines that are not your platform using "//" and unremark your platform.
00050 /// \n\n
00051 /// Should you choose to port this to your platform, make sure that all the
00052 /// required libraries are installed, then make sure to write an implementation
00053 /// for each of the functions in crossplatform.cpp, then you should get to the
00054 /// nitty gritty of making the minor platforms inconsistencies work.
00055 /// \n\n
00056 /// For most games there will be no need to directly call these functions, however if you decide
00057 /// you game is an exception, there is one key thing to remember about all of these functions.
00058 /// All of these may perform/behave slightly differently.
00059 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00060 
00061 /// @todo Make main page in documentation with wiki link and lisitng of required steps (build target and OS define), and dependencies required to build this.
00062 
00063 //Unremark one of these when not compiling with code::blocks
00064 //#define LINUX
00065 //#define MACOSX
00066 //#define WINDOWS
00067 
00068 //End Choose Your Platform
00069 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00070 
00071 // Includes
00072 #include "datatypes.h"
00073 
00074 #include <string>
00075 
00076 using namespace std;
00077 
00078 namespace phys
00079 {
00080     //Forward Declarations should go here
00081     class World;
00082 
00083     namespace crossplatform
00084     {
00085         /// @internal
00086         /// @brief Returns a string with a path/filename to the default Plugins config file
00087         /// @details Plugins.cfg is the file that determines which graphics plugins are loaded.
00088         /// This is a feature of the graphics subsystem and is generally not needed outside
00089         /// of engine code.
00090         /// @return A string which contains the path and filename of the plugins file
00091         string GetPluginsDotCFG();
00092 
00093         /// @internal
00094         /// @brief Returns a string with a path/filename to the default Graphics Subsytem settings file
00095         /// @details Settings.cfg is the file that determines how graphics settings are configured by default.
00096         /// This is a feature of the graphics subsystem and is generally not needed outside of engine code.
00097         /// @return A string which contains the path and filename of the graphics setts file
00098         string GetSettingsDotCFG();
00099 
00100         /// @brief Gets the Default Data Directory
00101         /// @details The directory returned by this function can be used to easily graphics objects. In general
00102         /// the Graphics subsystem can easily open files in this location with just their filename
00103         /// @return A string containing the path to the default Data Directory.
00104         string GetDataDirectory();
00105 
00106         /// @internal
00107         /// @brief This creates a data structure that can help SDL(User Input Subsystem) with Ogre(graphics subsystem)
00108         /// @details This creates a data structure that can help SDL(User Input Subsystem) with Ogre(graphics subsystem)
00109         /// This returns a named parameter list with valid settings to use Ogre rendering on a pre-existing SDL context
00110         /// @warning This is an engine internal, and shouldn't be used anywhere else. For all practical purposes is return gibberish
00111         void* GetSDLOgreBinder();
00112 
00113         /// @brief Pauses the program for a given period of time.
00114         /// @details Pauses the program for a given period of time.
00115         /// @param WaitTime The amount of time in milliseconds to wait
00116         void WaitMilliseconds(const Whole &WaitTime);
00117 
00118         /// @brief Renders the current world contents to the screen.
00119         /// @details This makes use of World internals to Render to the screen, So it is advised against calling this directly.
00120         /// Currently there is no known issue with calling this directly, but it is not thread safe and is run during the main loop
00121         /// at the aproppriate times.
00122         /// Handles the actual cross platform swapping of graphics buffers.
00123         /// @param TheWorld This is a pointer to the World to be rendered.
00124         void RenderPhysWorld(World *TheWorld);
00125         }
00126 }
00127 #endif
